revised_title: Investigation of the Prismatic Colours' Heating and Illuminating Powers and their Refrangibility
tldr: The author, William Herschel, investigates the heating and illuminating powers of different colored rays using a prism and a thermometer. He discovers that the red ray has the highest heating power, while the violet has the least. He also finds that the maximum illumination lies in the yellow or pale green range. Furthermore, Herschel suggests that radiant heat may be of different refrangibility and proposes using dark-green and smoked glasses for viewing the sun through telescopes.
